intro: Chamaesyce hirta, commonly known as hairy pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant has hairy, linear leaves and produces small, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and in open woodlands. Chamaesyce hirta is often used in ornamental gardening for its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in partial shade.
